main event: A ground-radar observation reported a globular-shaped, white object flying at a steady level with no change in speed or direction over the Pacific Ocean in 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as having no sound and disappeared after 10-15 seconds.
The report suggested it could have been a balloon, aircraft, or even ground-radar interference.
There was speculation that it could have been an asteroid, but it was concluded as a probable observer error of a KC-97 aircraft.
The investigation indicated a probable case of mistaken identity and was forwarded for further evaluation.
No photographs were included in the report.
